revised_title: On the Magnifying-Power of the Half-Prism and its Applications in Spectroscopy
tldr: The author discusses the magnifying power of the half-prism and its role in dispersion and purity of the spectrum. They explain the differences between various forms of compound prisms and their applications in spectroscopy, emphasizing the importance of direct-vision prisms for their equalized scale and loss of light throughout the spectrum.
